intro: Triuris hexophthalma, commonly known as the six-eyed triuris, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while the stems are hairy and woody. Triuris hexophthalma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
